Claude's Sonnet 4.5 has access to up-to-date information, but is considerably more expensive per output (nearly $1 per ticker). In the always-evolving world of investing, we understand it is **CRITICAL** to have up-to-date information to help make the best investment decisions, and it is our goal to provide this information. But considering there are thousands of companies that we would ideally be updating monthly, as well as future goals of also providing quick and digestible summaries and insights for newly released earnings and conference calls, breaking news, FED speeches, etc, this quickly becomes very costly.

For this reason, please consider **subscribing to our Patreon** or donating to enable QuickTick AI to provide as much value and up-to-date insight as possible to **allow you to make the most informed investment decisions with a level of efficiency not possible even a few years ago.** 100% of the funds will go straight to purchasing more API credits to continue expanding our high quality, up-to-date analysis for more and more companies, and further then into our future value-generating plans. Thanks! - QuickTick AI

# CECO Environmental Corp. (NASDAQ: CECO) Sell-Side Analysis Report

**Report Date:** October 10, 2024  
**Current Stock Price:** $27.93 (Yahoo Finance, as of market close Oct 10, 2024)  
**Market Capitalization:** $972.4M (Yahoo Finance, as of Oct 10, 2024)  
**52-Week Range:** $21.12 - $33.62  
**Avg. Daily Volume (3-mo):** 284,651 shares  

## Company Overview (187 words)
CECO Environmental Corp. is a global leader in designing, engineering, building, and maintaining high-quality air quality and fluid handling systems for industrial, municipal, and energy infrastructure applications. Founded in 1912 and headquartered in Dallas, Texas, the company operates through three segments: **Engineered Systems** (38% of Q2 2024 revenue; custom-engineered pollution control and fluid handling for power gen, refineries, data centers); **Industrial Process** (36%; aftermarket parts/services for OEMs in refining, power, water); and **Energy Transition Solutions** (26%; emerging tech like hydrogen reforming, carbon capture, electrolysis for clean energy).  

CECO serves critical end-markets including refining/petrochem (35% revenue), power gen (20%), data centers (growing to 15%+), industrial manufacturing, and municipal water/wastewater. With ~2,300 employees across 100+ locations in 15 countries, it reported record Q2 2024 backlog of $614M (+61% YoY), driven by energy transition demand. The company emphasizes innovation in decarbonization, leveraging M&A for bolt-on growth, and recurring revenue from aftermarket services (targeting 40%+ of sales). Positioned at the intersection of strict EPA regulations and green energy megatrends, CECO benefits from secular tailwinds like AI-driven data center expansion and net-zero goals, positioning it for multi-year compounding.

## Recent Developments
- **Q2 2024 Earnings (Aug 6, 2024)**: Revenue $111.7M (+26% YoY); Gross margin 28.5% (+200 bps); Adj. EBITDA $18.5M (+45% YoY, 16.6% margin); Net income $5.4M; EPS $0.16 (beat estimates). Raised FY2024 guidance: Revenue $440-455M (+22-26% YoY); Adj. EBITDA $68-72M (+36-46% YoY).
- **KB Duct Acquisition (Sep 3, 2024)**: Bought leading industrial ducting fabricator for $23M cash (0.4x sales multiple); adds $20M annual revenue, 25% EBITDA margins, expands data center/ETS exposure; accretive immediately.
- **Q3 2024 Order Wins (Sep-Oct 2024)**: $45M data center orders; $20M hydrogen/electrolysis packages; backlog now est. $650M+ (per earnings call updates).
- **Earnings Call Highlights (Aug 7, 2024)**: CEO Todd Jenkins noted 100%+ YoY growth in Energy Transition; data centers now 12% of backlog (up from 5%).

## Growth Strategy
- **Organic**: Double Energy Transition revenue to $100M+ by 2025 via data centers (AI boom), hydrogen (e.g., electrolyzer skids), CCUS; target aftermarket mix to 40% (higher margins).
- **M&A**: $100M+ dry powder; focus bolt-ons in ducting, filtration (e.g., KB Duct); 5 deals since 2021 added $150M revenue.
- **International Expansion**: 20% revenue from EMEA/APAC; new wins in Saudi Aramco hydrogen projects.
- **FY2025 Outlook (per Aug call)**: 15-20% revenue growth, leveraging $650M backlog conversion.

| Metric | Q2 2024 Actual | FY2024 Guidance (Raised) | YoY Growth |
|--------|----------------|---------------------------|------------|
| Revenue | $111.7M | $440-455M | +22-26% |
| Adj. EBITDA | $18.5M | $68-72M | +36-46% |
| Backlog | $614M | N/A | +61% |

## Company & Sector Headwinds and Tailwinds
| Category | Headwinds | Tailwinds |
|----------|-----------|-----------|
| **Company** | Supply chain inflation (steel +10% YoY); labor shortages in fabrication; project delays in refining (impacting 35% revenue). | Record backlog visibility; M&A pipeline; recurring aftermarket ramp (up 30% YoY). |
| **Sector (Env. Tech/Pollution Control)** | Cyclical industrial slowdown (e.g., US refining margins down 15% in H1); interest rates pressuring capex. | EPA regs (e.g., methane rules Jul 2024); data center capex $200B+ in 2024 (CBRE); IRA incentives for H2/CCUS ($369B allocated); global decarbonization (IEA: $4T annual need). |

## Existing Products/Services
- **Engineered Systems**: Dampers, fans, silencers, scrubbers for NOx/SOx/PM control.
- **Industrial Process**: Aftermarket filters, mist eliminators, filtration housings (e.g., Viledon brand).
- **Energy Transition**: Electrolyzer skids, reformers, CCUS modules, heat recovery.

## New Products/Services/Projects
- **Data Center Packages (2024 rollout)**: Modular AHUs, chillers for hyperscalers; $100M pipeline.
- **Hydrogen Solutions**: Acquired ETS in 2022; new electrolyzer integration (pilot with Plug Power, Q3 2024).
- **R&D Pipeline**: AI-optimized controls (announced Q1 2024); next-gen ceramic filters for batteries (target launch H2 2025).

## Market Share Approximations & Forecast
- **US Industrial Air Quality**: ~12-15% (leader in dampers/ducting; per mgmt. estimates, Aug call).
- **Data Center Fluid Handling**: ~5% (ramping to 10% by 2026 via KB Duct).
- **Hydrogen Equipment**: <5% (niche entrant, forecast +200% share gain by 2027 on IRA boom).
- **Forecast**: Market share +2-4% annually through 2027; total addrable market $10B+ growing 8% CAGR (mgmt./IEA data). Backlog conversion supports 20% revenue growth, outpacing sector 5-7%.

## Competitor Comparison
| Company (Ticker) | Mkt Cap | TTM Revenue Growth | Adj. EBITDA Margin | P/E (Fwd) | Key Diff vs. CECO |
|------------------|---------|---------------------|---------------------|-----------|-------------------|
| **CECO** | $972M | +22% | 15% | 16.5x | Balanced segments; M&A agility; ETS exposure. |
| **Clean Harbors (CLH)** | $12.5B | +8% | 12% | 28x | Waste focus; less growthy. |
| **Energy Recovery (ERII)** | $1.1B | +10% | 25% | 25x | Desalination niche; higher margins, less diversified. |
| **Tetra Tech (TTEK)** | $12B | +11% | 10% | 32x | Engineering services; lower growth. |
| **CECO Edge**: Superior backlog growth (+61% vs. peers <20%); undervalued on EV/EBITDA (9x fwd vs. peer 15x avg, per Yahoo/Bloomberg). |

## Partnerships, M&A, & Clients
- **Partnerships**: Plug Power (H2 pilots, 2024); Siemens Energy (CCUS JV exploratory); data center OEMs (e.g., Vertiv integration).
- **M&A (Recent)**: KB Duct (Sep 2024, $23M); Advance Pierre (2023); ETS (2022, $32M). Pipeline: 3-4 targets in filtration.
- **Major Clients**: Chevron, ExxonMobil (refining, 10% revenue); Google/Microsoft (data centers, ramping); GE Vernova (power); Saudi Aramco (H2). Potential: Nvidia-driven AI data centers ($500B capex wave); DOE H2 hubs.

## Other Qualitative Measures
- **ESG Strength**: 90% revenue tied to emissions reduction; CDP A- rating (2024).
- **Management**: CEO Todd Jenkins (since 2022) – ex-GTAT, driving 3x TSR since.
- **Risks**: Execution on megaprojects (e.g., 20% backlog >$10M); forex (20% int'l).
- **Catalysts**: Q3 earnings (Oct 31 est.); H2 order intake; M&A close.

## Investment Recommendation
- **Buy Rating: 8/10 (Strong Buy)** – High growth upside (20%+ CAGR to 2026) from backlog/ETS tailwinds; moderate risk via diversified backlog (60% <12-mo conversion) and low leverage (1.2x Net Debt/EBITDA). Trading at 9x fwd EV/EBITDA (peer 15x); undervalued vs. growth.
- **Fair Value Estimate: $38 (36% upside)** – DCF-based (15% IRR, 5% terminal, 20% 2025 growth); aligns with $80M 2025 EBITDA at 12x multiple. Suitable for growth portfolios targeting industrials/env tech. Hold if risk-averse to cyclicality.
